content: At least DFW does an excellent job at being self-aware. There are only a few poignant remarks in the whole essay, and every single one you admit reluctantly. Have you ever considered that men recommend DFW to you because of your interest in literature, and as you eventually allow to be pried out of your tightly pursed feminist lips, he is a genius and incredibly intelligent writer? You claim to understand your bias against him and men in general, spend a couple paragraphs talking about how bad it feels to have a man make commentary on the life of a woman. You get so close to being intellectual. You could use this insight to open your mind. Alas, this essay reveals that you couldn’t care less about your bias, that you’re going to continue pre-forming opinions about literature that you’ve never read because of some idiotic gender-pride, that you are not interested in having a truly academic discussion. Good luck.
